item.title: Ideas and Goals
item.description:
The motivation for this project comes from the importance of Grothendieck constructions in categorical algebra and higher homotopy theory. A major motivation for the author came from the theory of -sketches treated in the paper[1]. The author hopes to expand on and manoeuvre this theory for use in higher category theory, using model independent approaches as much as possible (in the sense of Riehl and Verity's -cosmoi).
Necessary pre-requisite build-up on enriched -categories in model independent language is needed. A good place to start is to work on adapting the work due to Heine[2], Haugseng and Chu[3] [4] [5], Hinich[6], and most importantly Gepner[7] In the process develop theories of enriched sketches and models in these contexts Once a suitable model-independent treatment of enriched -categories is present, define an analogous -category to to the -categorical case, along with appropriate notions of weaknesses
Translate and transfer the results in[1-1] to this context, especially the symmetry of internalization result
Translate and transfer the results of Characterizing Structured Fibrations using F-CategoriesCharacterizing Structured Fibrations using F-Categories to the -categorical context
Arkor, N., Bourke, J., & Ko, J. (2024, December 10). Enhanced 2-categorical structures, two-dimensional limit sketches and the symmetry of internalisation. arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2412.07475↩︎↩︎
Heine, H. (2023, July 21). An equivalence between enriched -categories and -categories with weak action. arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2009.02428↩︎
Haugseng, R. (2015). Rectification of enriched infinity-categories. Algebraic & Geometric Topology, 15(4), 1931–1982. https://doi.org/10.2140/agt.2015.15.1931↩︎
Chu, H., & Haugseng, R. (2023, November 21). Enriched homotopy-coherent structures. arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2308.11502↩︎
Haugseng, R. (2023, November 22). On the tensor product of enriched -categories. arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.2311.13362↩︎
Hinich, V. (2021, July 5). Yoneda lemma for enriched infinity categories. arXiv. https://doi.org/10.48550/arXiv.1805.07635↩︎
Gepner, D., & Haugseng, R. (2015). Enriched -categories via non-symmetric -operads. Advances in Mathematics, 279, 575–716. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.aim.2015.02.007↩︎
